developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page-label/users/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Label Users

Reading

Users that are associated with this label

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-label-id}/users HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-label-id}/users',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-label-id}/users",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-label-id}/users",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-label-id}/users"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of User nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

You can update a User by making a POST request to /{page_label_id}/users.

Permissions

Developers usually request these permissions for this endpoint:

Marketing Apps
No data
Page management Apps
  • manage_pages
  • pages_show_list
Other Apps
No data

Parameters

NameDescription
user_ids
list<int>

ID of users that the label will be applied to

Required

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node to which you POSTed.
Struct {
success: bool,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Deleting

You can dissociate a User from a PageLabel by making a DELETE request to /{page_label_id}/users.

Parameters

NameDescription
user_ids
list<int>

ID of users that the label will be unattached from

Required

Return Type

Struct {
success: bool,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page-parking/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Parking

Parking options for a Page. Useful for Facebook Pages that have a business with parking.

Reading

Parking information

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET v2.12/...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PageParking} HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PageParking}',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PageParking}",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PageParking}",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PageParking}"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

FieldDescription

lot

unsigned int32

Whether lot parking is available

Default

street

unsigned int32

Whether street parking is available

Default

valet

unsigned int32

Whether valet parking is available

Default

Edges

No edges

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

    '...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PagePaymentOptions}',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */

    "...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PagePaymentOptions}",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */

    }
);

    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PagePaymentOptions}",
    null,

    }
).executeAsync();

                               initWithGraphPath:@"...?fields={fieldname_of_type_PagePaymentOptions}"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];

                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

Reading

Notes of this page

Host: graph.facebook.com

  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/admin_notes',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */

    "/{page-id}/admin_notes",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);

    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/admin_notes",

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/admin_notes"
                                      parameters:params

                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of PageAdminNote nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
210 User not visible
200 Permissions error

Creating

You can make a POST request to admin_notes edge from the following paths:
  • /{page_id}/admin_notes
When posting to this edge, a PageAdminNote will be created.

Parameters

NameDescription
body
string

Note body. Max string length is 1000.

Required
user_id
int

ID of the user that this note is associate with.

Required

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node represented by id in the return type.
Struct {
id: numeric string,
}

100 Invalid parameter

  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/albums',

  );

  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */

    "/{page-id}/albums",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);

    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/albums",

  • /{page_id}/albums
When posting to this edge, an Album will be created.

Permissions

Developers usually request these permissions for this endpoint:

Marketing Apps
No data
Page management Apps
  • manage_pages
  • publish_pages
  • pages_show_list
Other Apps
No data

Parameters

NameDescription
contributors
list<int>

Contributors to turn this into a shared album
description
UTF-8 string

Deprecated. Use the message param

DeprecatedSupports Emoji
is_default
boolean
Default value: false

true indicates that the request will create the application specific album
location
string

A text location of the album for non-page locations
make_shared_album
boolean
Default value: false

Ensures the created album is a shared album
message
string

The album's caption. This appears below the title of the album in the album view
name
UTF-8 string

The title of the album

Supports Emoji
place
place tag

The ID of a location page to tag the album with
privacy
Privacy Parameter

The privacy of the album
tags
list<int>

Deprecated

Deprecated
visible
string

Deprecated. Use privacy

Deprecated

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node represented by id in the return type.
Struct {
id: numeric string,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
200 Permissions error
100 Invalid parameter
2010 Photos calls have been temporarily disabled for this application
16500 Album description is too long.

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/assigned_users/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Assigned Users

Reading

Business and system users assigned to this page.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/assigned_users HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */

  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/assigned_users',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */

    "/{page-id}/assigned_users",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }

    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/assigned_users",
    null,

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/assigned_users"
                                      parameters:params

                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

NameDescription
business
numeric string or integer

The business associated with this Page

Required

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {},
    "summary": {}
}

data

A list of AssignedUser nodes.

The following fields will be added to each node that is returned:

FieldDescription

permitted_roles

list<string>

Roles that are assignable on this object

role

string

Role of this particular user on this object

Default

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

summary

Aggregated information about the edge, such as counts. Specify the fields to fetch in the summary param (like summary=total_count).

FieldDescription

total_count

unsigned int32

Total number of business and system users assigned to this page

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

You can update a Page by making a POST request to /{page_id}/assigned_users.

Parameters

NameDescription
role
enum {MANAGER, CONTENT_CREATOR, MODERATOR, ADVERTISER, INSIGHTS_ANALYST}

Page permission role to assign this user

Required
user
int

Business user id or system user id

Required

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node to which you POSTed.
Struct {
success: bool,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
200 Permissions error

Deleting

You can dissociate a Page from a Page by making a DELETE request to /{page_id}/assigned_users.

Parameters

NameDescription
user
int

Business user id or system user id

Required

Return Type

Struct {
success: bool,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/audio_copyrights/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Reading

The audio copyrights owned by this Page.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/audio_copyrights HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */

  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/audio_copyrights',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/audio_copyrights",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/audio_copyrights",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/audio_copyrights"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {},
    "summary": {}
}

data

A list of AudioCopyright nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

summary

Aggregated information about the edge, such as counts. Specify the fields to fetch in the summary param (like summary=total_count).

FieldDescription

total_count

unsigned int32

Total number of reference files on the page

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
200 Permissions error

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/bc_sponsored_posts/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Bc Sponsored Posts

Reading

A list of posts where the page is tagged as sponsor in branded content posts, only posts that are marked as shared with sponsor on creation.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/bc_sponsored_posts HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/bc_sponsored_posts',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/bc_sponsored_posts",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/bc_sponsored_posts",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/bc_sponsored_posts"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Permissions

Developers usually request these permissions for this endpoint:

Marketing Apps
  • ads_management
  • manage_pages
  • business_management
  • user_likes
Page management Apps
No data
Other Apps
Permissions are not usually requested.

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of EntWithSponsor nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/blocked/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Users or Pages Blocked from a Page

This edge is for managing the set of people or pages blocked from a page. All of these methods require a Page Access Token.

Reading

User or Page Profiles blocked from this Page

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/blocked HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/blocked',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/blocked",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/blocked",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/blocked"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Permissions

Developers usually request these permissions for this endpoint:

Marketing Apps
  • ads_management
  • manage_pages
  • pages_show_list
Page management Apps
  • manage_pages
Other Apps
No data

Parameters

NameDescription
uid
int

uid
user
int

user

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of Profile nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
200 Permissions error
210 User not visible
100 Invalid parameter

Creating

You can make a POST request to blocked edge from the following paths:
  • /{page_id}/blocked
When posting to this edge, no Graph object will be created.

Parameters

NameDescription
asid
list<>

List of App Scoped User IDs to block
uid
list<numeric string>

Deprecated. Same as user
user
list<numeric string>

List of User or Page IDs to block. This or uid is required

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node to which you POSTed.
Map {
numeric string: bool
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
200 Permissions error
210 User not visible

Updating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can dissociate a User from a Page by making a DELETE request to /{page_id}/blocked.

Parameters

NameDescription
asid
int

AppScopedUserID to unblock
uid
int

Deprecated. Same as user
user
int

List of User or Page IDs to unblock. This or uid is required

Return Type

Struct {
success: bool,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
210 User not visible
200 Permissions error

Graph API Version
v2.12

Reading

SELF_EXPLANATORY

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/broadcast_messages HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/broadcast_messages',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/broadcast_messages",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/broadcast_messages",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/broadcast_messages"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Business Activities

Reading

Edge for GET business activities related to the page.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/business_activities HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/business_activities',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/business_activities",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/business_activities",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/business_activities"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/call_to_actions/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Call To Actions

Reading

The call-to-action created by this Page

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/call_to_actions HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/call_to_actions',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/call_to_actions",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/call_to_actions",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/call_to_actions"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of PageCallToAction nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Creating

Permissions

  • A page access token with pages_manage_cta permission is required.
You can make a POST request to call_to_actions edge from the following paths:
  • /{page_id}/call_to_actions
When posting to this edge, a PageCallToAction will be created.

Parameters

NameDescription
android_app_id
int

ID of the App that stores the destination info on Android
android_deeplink
string

Destination deeplink for the call-to-action on Android
android_destination_type
enum {WEBSITE, APP_DEEPLINK, FACEBOOK_APP, PHONE_CALL, MESSENGER, EMAIL, NONE}
Default value: NONE

Destination type for the call-to-action on Android
android_package_name
string

Destination app for the call-to-action on Android
android_url
URL

Destination url for the call-to-action on Android
email_address
string

Email address that can be contacted by a user
intl_number_with_plus
string

International phone number with plus that can be called through a phone
iphone_app_id
int

ID fo the App that stores the destination info on iPhone
iphone_deeplink
string

Destination deeplink for the call-to-action on iPhone
iphone_destination_type
enum {WEBSITE, APP_DEEPLINK, FACEBOOK_APP, PHONE_CALL, MESSENGER, EMAIL, NONE}
Default value: NONE

Destination type for the call-to-action on iPhone
iphone_url
URL

Destination url for the call-to-action on iPhone
type
enum {BOOK_NOW, CALL_NOW, CHARITY_DONATE, CONTACT_US, DONATE_NOW, MESSAGE, OPEN_APP, PLAY_NOW, SHOP_NOW, SIGN_UP, WATCH_NOW, GET_OFFER, GET_OFFER_VIEW, REQUEST_QUOTE, BOOK_APPOINTMENT, LISTEN, EMAIL, LEARN_MORE, REQUEST_APPOINTMENT, GET_DIRECTIONS, BUY_TICKETS, PLAY_MUSIC, VISIT_GROUP}

The type of action

Required
web_destination_type
enum {EMAIL, MESSENGER, NONE, WEBSITE}
Default value: NONE

Destination type for the call-to-action on desktop
web_url
URL

Destination url for the call-to-action on desktop

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node represented by id in the return type.
Struct {
id: numeric string,
}

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter
200 Permissions error
210 User not visible

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/canvas_elements/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Canvas Elements

Reading

The canvas elements associated with this page

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/canvas_elements HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/canvas_elements',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/canvas_elements",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/canvas_elements",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/canvas_elements"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

    "paging": {}
}

Creating

  • /{page_id}/canvas_elements
When posting to this edge, a CanvasBodyElement will be created.

Parameters

NameDescription
canvas_button
Object

Create a canvas button that belongs to a page
name
string
Default value: Button

Name of the button
button_color
string
Default value: FF000000

The color of the button

Object

The text inside the button

Required

enum {BUTTON_OUTLINE, BUTTON_FILLED}
Default value: BUTTON_OUTLINE

The style of the button

Object

the destination url after user clicks the button, by setting this, the canvas button will have action with OPEN URL type

enum {LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT}
Default value: CENTER

The alignment of the text on the button

string
Default value: FF777777

int64
Default value: 15

The size of the font for the text on the button

Default value: sans-serif

float
Default value: 0

The padding above the button

string

float
Default value: 0

Default value: FFFFFFFF

developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/checkin_posts/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Checkin Posts

Reading

All public posts in which the page has been tagged as the location.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/checkin_posts HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/checkin_posts',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/checkin_posts",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/checkin_posts",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/checkin_posts"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

This endpoint doesn't have any parameters.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of PagePost nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
210 User not visible
200 Permissions error

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.
developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/conversations/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Conversations

Reading

This Page's conversations

Note: Time-based pagination is not available for the conversations endpoint.

Permissions

A page access token with read_page_mailboxes permission can be used to view any conversation in which the page is involved. The user requesting the page access token must be an admin, editor, or moderator of the page.

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/conversations HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/conversations',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/conversations",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);
/* make the API call */
new GraphRequest(
    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/conversations",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {
        public void onCompleted(GraphResponse response) {
            /* handle the result */
        }
    }
).executeAsync();
// For more complex open graph stories, use `FBSDKShareAPI`
// with `FBSDKShareOpenGraphContent`
/* make the API call */
FBSDKGraphRequest *request = [[FBSDKGraphRequest alloc]
                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/conversations"
                                      parameters:params
                                      HTTPMethod:@"GET"];
[request startWithCompletionHandler:^(FBSDKGraphRequestConnection *connection,
                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];
If you want to learn how to use the Graph API, read our Using Graph API guide.

Parameters

NameDescription
folder
string

The target folder to retrieve the conversations from.
tags
list<string>

Tags applied when retrieving the conversations.

Fields

Reading from this edge will return a JSON formatted result:

{
    "data": [],
    "paging": {}
}

data

A list of UnifiedThread nodes.

paging

For more details about pagination, see the Graph API guide.

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
200 Permissions error
100 Invalid parameter
540 Messaging is not available for this user
190 Invalid OAuth 2.0 Access Token
279 Reading messages for a Page requires the extended permission read_page_mailboxes

Creating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Updating

Deleting

developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/copyright_manual_claims/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Copyright Manual Claims

Reading

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Creating

You can make a POST request to copyright_manual_claims edge from the following paths:
  • /{page_id}/copyright_manual_claims
When posting to this edge, a VideoCopyrightMatch will be created.

Parameters

NameDescription
action
enum {MANUAL_REVIEW, MONITOR, BLOCK, CLAIM_AD_EARNINGS, REQUEST_TAKEDOWN}

The action to apply to the match entity, default is Manual Review.
countries
Object

The location to apply to the action, default is Global.
included_countries
list<UTF-8 encoded string>
excluded_countries
list<UTF-8 encoded string>
match_content_type
enum {VIDEO_AND_AUDIO, VIDEO_ONLY, AUDIO_ONLY}

The media type of the matching content, can be video, audio or both.

Required
matched_asset_id
numeric string or integer

The ID of the matched asset in the match.

Required
reference_asset_id
numeric string or integer

The ID of the reference asset for which the page is manually creating the match.

Required

Return Type

This endpoint supports read-after-write and will read the node represented by id in the return type.
Struct {
match_id: numeric string,
}

Validation Rules

ErrorDescription
100 Invalid parameter

Updating

You can't perform this operation on this endpoint.

Deleting

developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/events/index.html
Graph API Version
v2.12

Page Events

Events associated with for a Facebook Page.

Reading Page events requires a valid Page access token or User access token with basic permissions.

Reading

Events for this Page

Example

Graph API Explorer 
GET /v2.12/{page-id}/events HTTP/1.1
Host: graph.facebook.com
/* PHP SDK v5.0.0 */
/* make the API call */
try {
  // Returns a `Facebook\FacebookResponse` object
  $response = $fb->get(
    '/{page-id}/events',
    '{access-token}'
  );
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookResponseException $e) {
  echo 'Graph returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
} catch(Facebook\Exceptions\FacebookSDKException $e) {
  echo 'Facebook SDK returned an error: ' . $e->getMessage();
  exit;
}
$graphNode = $response->getGraphNode();
/* handle the result */
/* make the API call */
FB.api(
    "/{page-id}/events",
    function (response) {
      if (response && !response.error) {
        /* handle the result */
      }
    }
);

    AccessToken.getCurrentAccessToken(),
    "/{page-id}/events",
    null,
    HttpMethod.GET,
    new GraphRequest.Callback() {

            /* handle the result */

                               initWithGraphPath:@"/{page-id}/events"
                                      parameters:params

                                      id result,
                                      NSError *error) {
    // Handle the result
}];

Parameters

NameDescription
event_state_filter
list<enum{canceled, draft, scheduled_draft_for_publication, published}>

filter events with its state
include_canceled
boolean

Whether include canceled events.
time_filter
enum{upcoming, past}

filter events whether it is upcoming, past
type
enum{attending, created, declined, maybe, not_replied}

Query events for which the user has this particular rsvp_status set
